snippet: Questions have been raised over the methodology of a 2010 study that reported a steep fall in Afghanistan’s maternal mortality rate, which is used to measure improvement in a nation’s health.
abstract: British and Irish Agencies Afghanistan Group finds improvement in maternal mortality rate in Afghanistan reported by United States Agency for International Development in 2010 is implausible; 2010 study claimed that maternal mortality had dropped to 327 in 2010 from 1,600 deaths in 2002 for every 100,000 live births.
lead_paragraph: Questions have been raised over the methodology of a 2010 study that reported a steep fall in Afghanistan’s maternal mortality rate, which is used to measure improvement in a nation’s health.

headline.main: Reported Gains in Afghan Maternal Health Are Found to Be Implausible
headline.print_headline: Health Report on Childbirth by Afghans Is Challenged

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United States Agency for International Development
